body:
@Jareechang I actually noticed this yesterday. I think this might be fixed by #3819 specifically https://github.com/chartjs/Chart.js/pull/3819/files#diff-de7249441169d0e646c53d8220e8b0c5L645

could you test out that PR and see?
@etimberg, sure i'll have a look at that

I checked out PR #3819 and tested it out but it doesn't seem to resolve this issue. 

That being said, I think we may be able to use some of the hooks in that PR to resolve this issue. What I think would be great is an additional method is a `beforeCallback` hook to handle any pre-checks.
@simonbrunel, nice! I checked it and works great. Did you want to add that as PR ? or I can do that if you are too busy. Let me know.
@Jareechang can you please open a PR with that change ðŸ˜„
sure @etimberg, I'll make a PR with tests for this.

issue.title: Added Patch to update tooltip only when active element has changed

repository.name: Chart.js
repository.description: Simple HTML5 Charts using the <canvas> tag

issue.body: As title states, added patch for Issue #3746 with test cases. Please review when you have a chance! @etimberg or @simonbrunel.

issue.title: Toolstips slow performance in Chrome windows 10

repository.name: Chart.js
repository.description: Simple HTML5 Charts using the <canvas> tag

issue.body: I have problems with the performance in Chrome (56.0.2924.87) on windows 10. When displaying maybe 10 charts in a page and hovering over a datapoint the tooltip animates very slowly from the last selected point to the new. It's so slow that you get bored and the cpu fan on my pc starts. The pc should be about twice as fast as my old mac. In Firefox on Windows and in Chrome on mac hoovering tooltips is fast and smooth. I have enabled gpu ignore in chrome because I saw a few issues, but it didn't help.  Anyone have an idea how to fix this issue?
